alert.note: Alert for South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 05 at 6:47AM MST until March 06 at 7:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS SUNDAY AFTERNOON... .A weather system passing north of the area on Sunday will generate strong west to southwest flow over the area, resulting in wind speeds in the 25 to 35 mph range by the afternoon. Very dry conditions persist with relative humidity values across the desert lowlands to be in the lower teens. These conditions will result in critical fire danger that will allow fires to spread quickly. Humidity values in the mountain will be higher and will lessen fire danger chances to below critical thresholds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 055, 056, 111, AND 112... The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 111 and 112 in southwest and south central New Mexico. Fire weather zone 055 and 056 in far west Texas. * WIND...West to southwest winds of 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * HUMIDITY...8 to 14 percent * HIGHEST THREAT...is located in the lowland deserts in Sierra, Luna, Dona Ana, Otero and Hudspeth counties. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands
